helper

Library of various helper functions.

Functions
s16toa
extern void s16toa(
signed short v,
char *ptr
)

Converts a signed 16-bit number into a 7 byte ascii string (6 for the number and sign + 1 null-terminator).

s32toa
extern void s32toa(
signed long v,
char *ptr
)

Converts a signed 32-bit number into a 12 byte ascii string (11 for the number and sign + 1 null-terminator).

fract16toa
#ifndef __cplusplus void fract16toa(
_Fract a,
char *ptr
)

Converts a fixed point _Fract number into a 7-bytes ascii string (6 for the number + 1 null-terminator).

floatqtoa
#ifdef __cplusplus void floatqtoa(
float a,
char *ptr
)

Converts a float number lower than 1.0 into a 7-bytes ascii string (6 for the number + 1 null-terminator).

floattoa
#ifdef __cplusplus void floattoa(
float a,
char *ptr
)

Converts a float number lower than 300.0 into a 8-bytes ascii string (7 for the number + 1 null-terminator).

E.g.: -327.68

ParseComma
unsigned char ParseComma(
const char *str,
unsigned char n,
...
)

Identify the n tokens delimited by a comma.

Takes as parameter as many pointers to a pointer that will contain the address of the first character after each of the commas, or null if a comma is not found.

Warning: Modifies the passed string to have null instead of commas to facilitate further token parsing

Return value: 0: success nonzero: parse error

ParseCommaGetNumParam

Checks how many tokens are passed on a command.

The input string is of the format ",45,128,-99".

Parameters - Return value: Number of parameters

ParseCommaGetInt
unsigned char ParseCommaGetInt(
const char *str,
int n,
...
)

Identify the n tokens delimited by a comma. Decodes the tokens assuming they are ints.  This function doesn't verify the number of tokens passed: if there are more than n tokens, it decodes the first n and returns success.

The input string is of the format ",45,128,-99".  Here the tokens are 45, 128, -99.

Takes as parameter as many pointers to an int that will contain the integer token.

Return value: 0: success nonzero: parse error

ParseCommaGetLong
unsigned char ParseCommaGetLong(
const char *str,
int n,
...
)

Identify the n tokens delimited by a comma. Decodes the tokens assuming they are long ints.

For example, the string "M,45,128,-99" is decoded in the tokens 45, 128, -99.

Takes as parameter as many pointers to a long that will contain the token.

Warning: Modifies the passed string to have null instead of commas to facilitate further token parsing

Return value: 0: success nonzero: parse error

TimeAddSeconds
unsigned char TimeAddSeconds(
unsigned short hour,
unsigned short min,
unsigned short sec,
unsigned short ds,
unsigned short *ohour,
unsigned short *omin,
unsigned short *osec
)

Adds ds seconds to a time specified in hh:mm:ss. If the time wraps around the return value indicates how many days to add to the current date.

hour: 00-23 min: 00-59 sec: 00-59

ds: seconds to add to current time

Return value: 0: success, no wrap around nonzero: time wrapped around, return value indicates how many days?

format3s16
char *format3s16(
char *strptr,
signed short x,
signed short y,
signed short z
)

Formats 3 signed short numbers into an ascii string.  Numbers are space separated, including a space after the last number, however the string is not null terminated.

The function returns a pointer to the first byte after the end of the string.

Parameters
strptr
char*

pointer to the buffer that will receive the string

x
signed short

First number to format

y
signed short

Second number to format

z
signed short

Third number to format

format1u32
char *format1u32(
char *strptr,
unsigned long a
)

Formats 1 unsigned 32-bit number into an ascii string.  The string includes a space after the number, however the string is not null terminated.

The function returns a pointer to the first byte after the end of the string.

Parameters
strptr
char*

pointer to the buffer that will receive the string

a
unsigned long

Number to format

format4fract16

Formats 3 _Fract numbers into an ascii string.  Numbers are space separated, including a space after the last number, however the string is not null terminated.

The function returns a pointer to the first byte after the end of the string.

Numbers must be <1.0

Formats 3 float numbers into an ascii string.  Numbers are space separated, including a space after the last number, however the string is not null terminated.

Numbers must be <300.

The function returns a pointer to the first byte after the end of the string.

str2xxyyzz
void str2xxyyzz(
char *string,
unsigned char *x,
unsigned char *y,
unsigned char *z
)

Converts a 6-characters long  string of type x1x2y1y2z1z2 with x1, x2, y1, y2, z1, z2 digits between 0-9 into the corresponding numbers x, y, z.  E.g. x=x1*10+x2.

No error checking is performed.

Parameters
string
char*

6-characters long string.

x
unsigned char*

Pointer to the variable receiving the x value

y
unsigned char*

Pointer to the variable receiving the y value

z
unsigned char*

Pointer to the variable receiving the z value

Returns

-

prettyprint_hexascii
void prettyprint_hexascii(
FILE *f,
char *string,
unsigned short n,
unsigned char nl
)

Pretty prints a string which comprises printable characters and non-printable characters. Non-printable characters are printed in hex enclosed in square brackets.

Parameters
F
FILE*

File where to print

string
char*

String to print

n
unsigned short

Number of characters to print

nl
unsigned char

0 for no newline, otherwise prints a newline

Returns

-

hist_init
void hist_init(
unsigned long *hist,
unsigned short n
)

Initialises a histogram for N0 natural numbers.

The histogram holds n bins.

Parameters
hist
unsigned long*

Pointer to a histogram, which holds n bins.

n
unsigned short

Number of histogram entries

Returns

-

hist_insert
void hist_insert(
unsigned long *hist,
unsigned short n,
unsigned short width,
unsigned short value
)

Inserts a datapoint in a histogram for N0 natural numbers.

The histogram holds n bins with the specified width.  Bin 0 is [0;width[ bin 1 is [width;2*width[, etc.  The last bin is [(n-1)*width;inf[.

Negative datapoints are entered in bin 0.  Datapoints larger than (n-1)*width are entered in the last bin.

Parameters
hist
unsigned long*

Pointer to a histogram, which holds n bins.

n
unsigned short

Number of histogram entries

width
unsigned short

Width of each bin.

value
unsigned short

Value to add to the histogram

Returns

-

slist_add
void slist_add(
unsigned long *slist,
int n,
unsigned long v
)

Adds a value v into a sorted list slist of n elements

The ordering of the list is kep

Parameters
hist

Pointer to a histogram, which holds n bins.

n
int

Number of histogram entries

width

Width of each bin.

value

Value to add to the histogram

Returns
